E87A5F4389354F08BD3CDF11C02889D0.description: Identify possible short-term and long-term saving goals.

627CD09E540C431BA0AF52F96828D8C1.description: Discuss the importance of responsible spending and saving.

913203D4939341908F723D3F3412E5E6.description: Donating money can have a significant impact on the well-being of others.

C4293BC72C0840AD8BE412CBE9080166.description: Saving is essential for personal short-term and long-term goals.

37C558EFB70949A48976C1495072405A.description: Individuals can develop good habits early in life to make responsible money decisions now and in the future.

ADB57FD5F8A9469EA07151952AA46BFA.description: Responsible money management can allow individuals to help others in need through donation.

37FEBB1798274778ABFEBA3516BE5EC8.description: Responsible saving can be supported through strategies, such as considering needs and wants, setting financial goals, establishing a savings account and putting earned money aside on a regular basis.

8877BF7C893846719619900BAF1470E5.description: Saving means not spending in order to keep money aside for unexpected expenses and to pay for purchases, activities, and future plans or goals.

EEAAA2B74ED941C4A54CB59AF5E6D509.description: Responsible spending can be supported through strategies, such as buying needed items first, buying items that are affordable, taking time when making purchases and not purchasing more than is needed.

D6EC4C80161D41AAB8F618DC7F551C89.description: Good money habits allow individuals to appreciate the value of money and the importance of managing it.

ED2416A38F8A4AE48F310D784CCA61AB.description: Students describe strategies that support responsible money management.

74B786DC454249909BC8653B6CE45B62.description: Financial Literacy: Informed financial decision making contributes to the well-being of individuals, groups, and communities.

7FDAEE6C302B4D4CBBC3EA3A40AC1B4D.description: Communicate how internal and external factors can affect development.

59A19901FDE44660A1FF374DE1632F1B.description: Internal and external factors influence development at different rates.

E0DAC73F3A184B19A2BDD787727076DA.description: Development can happen in predictable life patterns or stages.

0D90E84CFFF14437A39DAE1B7F746FC1.description: During development, progress may be made in some areas and limited in other areas.

4B816450B2D54F34B1C6374525472821.description: Development is a natural, multi-faceted, and continuous process.

BD0FB69C22644056A93970692990BBB2.description: External developmental factors include family, culture, environment and social relationships.

28F6F838E33241A4969D6A30EAC2DA50.description: Internal developmental factors include family traits (genetics), personality traits, life experiences and previous learning.

BFC60E760EF74E0FBB4E30C92119938B.description: Life stages include infancy, childhood, adolescence and adulthood.

4331B834452A4E16842D68B43E02B68C.description: Each developmental stage comes with new expectations, abilities and responsibilities.

7EF5989EE8AA4900A1EE94CF9F13DA72.description: One stage of development establishes the necessary body conditions for the next stage.

5F29F9C1E30A49EFB2F4846A2A520337.description: Development can be observed, experienced and described.

E18C2D26D5734492ACA6021CCE5E7856.description: Areas of development are interconnected and include mind, body, spirit, emotion and self-image.

C76A7FD6F49F4BCFB8BBA73444737E8A.description: Development is the process of becoming a unique person.

54507AA4958C4910B1BBC933DC3A85FD.description: Students examine and describe development related to personal growth.

B81538D23C0B44228FBB39A44E18C35F.description: Growth and Development: Decision making that optimizes personal health and well-being is informed by understanding growth and development.

B6D021E55B064792ABC3318F1A51D613.description: Generate solutions to problems in a variety of relationship contexts.

05F00848D0F74A35B1B9EC2CFF95D579.description: Relationship building and resolution include empathy, forgiveness, compromise and respect.

17A2DA22D64D44C4817F07C6D51C1075.description: Resolution involves individuals taking responsibility for actions and words.

5F53C230CEC247F1B446C438F4E78B99.description: Friends can resolve conflicts by listening to one another, trying to understand each other�s point of view, apologizing, taking time to consider solutions and getting help from a peer or an adult.

968AA6644D5B4A8792BFD8873F8B7F8E.description: Problem solving is a process of finding a resolution to a problem.

06FF506409884574AF454EC45F842702.description: Individuals in healthy relationships resolve conflict by sharing the responsibility in coming to fair solutions to problems.

D0F27C4D67B342EEAE4A0DF4F22965B9.description: Healthy Relationships: Personal well-being is supported through positive relationships built on communication, collaboration, empathy, and respect.

D3D8DA149F014A1E84CC19C443F62181.description: Examine how food-preparation techniques can affect the characteristics of common foods.

9CDFF46386204BA59D05350D9E95A4AD.description: Rules and guidelines can promote safety in various contexts.

22D2208E1CB74E5196CAB1F4472F6202.description: Experiences that involve challenges and taking risks can develop knowledge around safety.

9643CCA762A64EFD96CFA32411F9F8F8.description: Specific rules or guidelines can determine a course of action, prevent accidents and protect safety of self and others.

65FF55B95E2E4747BFDB810F578D3108.description: Proactive planning includes wearing appropriate and protective gear, awareness of instructions and guidelines and digital citizenship (responsible conduct and safety).

D9118B1A837C4BC08176C7FB83B18CE0.description: Safety: A lifetime of optimal well-being is supported by prioritizing health and safety.

AD3A35A7561C4A5B84163C1AA0F5581A.description: Identify emotions in a variety of situations.

0C5BC0124EEE4969A3AAAEF2A48D1B52.description: Practise self-regulation to maintain engagement in a variety of situations.

B2C9FAEF00CB40AE99CB3567EE789A44.description: Examine how roles can provide individuals with opportunities to develop.

47AFF70B876E4116BCBF477FC38FBAD6.description: Investigate how personal talents and potential are influenced by role models.

79F0655D2E8648FCA412835A5F54C295.description: Resources are available when self-regulation strategies are not effective or when an individual is feeling overwhelmed.

80241B8D846C43C99A288EACB7855785.description: The development of resilience is supported through understanding of emotions.

2EB001EBCEC74B109ED5136589C534BA.description: Individuals can use self-regulation to adjust to various situations.

B6389EECEF854994BB8476613C59161E.description: Individuals can assume or earn various roles in their lifetime.

8949FD073E8D465B9D405FC4F5678888.description: Roles are established and maintained through culture and relationships with people and the land.

A0EFD14C7CA34C76B9B4E6F0D50E6A9A.description: Roles are influenced by family, role models, learning environments, and community.

82EAC248C9D642A9A390CC111153D012.description: Roles and occupations have requirements, purposes, and expectations.

C36F1C23FDC64F5DBB0DE5393E47CCAB.description: Self-regulation and resilience can be supported by resources, such as parents. family and kin, teachers and school, counsellors, health-care professionals, community agencies, spiritual leaders, Elders and Knowledge Keepers.

83A76E2F6801481EA0F39E0268F8D455.description: Self-regulation helps individuals to engage with commitments, expectations, and tasks.

AA6AB42FC2D7460099E97E6845C2235E.description: Children may spend time between more than one family.

C672F18D424A4745BD40F718BA40AB1B.description: Families can be intergenerational with many generations residing in one home.

058DFD1FCE384D939DFBF36392DC4CF1.description: Family structures can vary; may include extended family; and may consist of a single parent, a mother and a father, stepparents, two fathers, or two mothers.

73EFE1CFC5B3460495A9132C6E228EB8.description: Students identify and demonstrate how teamwork supports positive interactions during physical activity.

2E16C1EA95674B7DA02280834A31B0E7.description: Participation in a variety of physical activities supports well-being.
